intro: Tarenna luzoniensis, commonly known as Luzon tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature, containing a single seed.
